intro: Zephyranthes ischihualasta, commonly known as the Mexican rain lily, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its erect, grass-like foliage and showy, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically blooms after rainfall, often during the summer months, and produces small, capsule-like fruits. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Its ability to survive in arid conditions makes it an adaptable and resilient ornamental plant.
